com.ftdi.j2xx.interfaces

Interface I2cSlave

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FT_4222_I2c_Slave

    public interface I2cSlave

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getAddress(int[] addr)
      Get the address of the I2C slave device.
      int init()
      Initialize the device as an I2C slave.
      int read(byte[] buffer, int sizeToTransfer, int[] sizeTransferred)
      Read data from the buffer of I2C slave device.
      int reset()
      Reset the I2C slave device.
      int setAddress(int addr)
      Set the address of the I2C slave device.
      int write(byte[] buffer, int sizeToTransfer, int[] sizeTransferred)
      Write data to the I2C slave device.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        int init()
        Initialize the device as an I2C slave.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • reset

        int reset()
        Reset the I2C slave device.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • getAddress

        int getAddress(int[] addr)
        Get the address of the I2C slave device.
        Parameters:
        addr - The address of the I2C slave device.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • setAddress

        int setAddress(int addr)
        Set the address of the I2C slave device.
        Parameters:
        addr - The 7-bit address of the I2C slave device.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • read

        int read(byte[] buffer,
       int sizeToTransfer,
       int[] sizeTransferred)
        Read data from the buffer of I2C slave device.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer array that receives the data from the device.
        sizeToTransfer - Number of bytes to read from the device.
        sizeTransferred - The actual number of bytes read from the device.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • write

        int write(byte[] buffer,
        int sizeToTransfer,
        int[] sizeTransferred)
        Write data to the I2C slave device.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer array that contains the data to be written to the device
        sizeToTransfer - Number of bytes to write to the device.
        sizeTransferred - The actual number of bytes written to the device.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.
